    • Method Detail

      • getEnhancedDeps

        public ImmutableSortedSet<BuildRule> getEnhancedDeps(BuildRuleResolver ruleResolver,
                                            Iterable<BuildRule> declaredDeps,
                                            Iterable<BuildRule> inferredDeps)
        Description copied from interface: DependencyEnhancer
        A Buildable may employ graph enhancement to alter its dependencies. If it does this, it must return the new dependencies via this method. The inferredDeps are derived by looking at a ConstructorArg's public fields other than deps and finding any that are or contain BuildRules. The union of these and the declaredDeps provides all the known dependencies of a rule.

        Implementors of this interface will normally want to return the inferredDeps unchanged, and only modify the declaredDeps. As such, the general usage pattern is: 

         public ImmutableSortedSet>BuildRule> getEnhancedDeps(
     BuildRuleResolver ruleResolver,
     Iterable declaredDeps,
     Iterable inferredDeps) {
   ImmutableSortedSet.Builder>BuildRule> builder = ImmutableSortedSet.naturalOrder();
   builder.addAll(inferredDeps);

   ...

   return builder.build();
 }
        Specified by:
        getEnhancedDeps in interface DependencyEnhancer
        Parameters:
        ruleResolver - that can be used to get the BuildRule that corresponds to a BuildTarget if the rule for the target has already been constructed.
        declaredDeps - The BuildRules declared in the deps parameter of a rule.
        inferredDeps - Any dependencies detected by scanning all the parameters except deps of a rule.
        Returns:
        The deps for the BuildRule that contains this Buildable. These may differ from the deps specified in the original build file due to graph enhancement.

      • runTests

        public List<Step> runTests(BuildContext buildContext,
                  ExecutionContext executionContext,
                  TestSelectorList testSelectorList)
        Runs the tests specified by the "srcs" of this class. If this rule transitively depends on other java_test() rules, then they will be run separately.
        Specified by:
        runTests in interface TestRule
        Parameters:
        buildContext - Because this method may be run without BuildEngine.build(BuildContext, BuildRule) having been run, this is supplied in case any non-cacheable build work needs to be done.
        executionContext - Provides context for creating Steps.
        testSelectorList - Provides a way of selecting which tests to include or exclude from a run.
        Returns:
        the commands required to run the tests

      • onAmendVmArgs

        protected void onAmendVmArgs(ImmutableList.Builder<String> vmArgsBuilder,
                 Optional<TargetDevice> targetDevice)
        Override this method if you need to amend vm args. Subclasses are required to call super.onAmendVmArgs(...).

      • hasTestResultFiles

        public boolean hasTestResultFiles(ExecutionContext executionContext)
        Description copied from interface: TestRule
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the files that contain the test results for this rule are present.

        If this method returns true, then TestRule.interpretTestResults(ExecutionContext, boolean) should be able to be called directly.

        Specified by:
        hasTestResultFiles in interface TestRule
